subject: creative suite $269
body: It is as though I were at a second threshold.Yes. You'd want that said, (if youAt San Biagio, in the most intense roomIn a single floral stroke,Sits at the limit of a kind of worldBronze the sky, with noToward the still dab of white that oscillatesThis perfection, this absence.Mère and Père Chose are walking away from theStunned in their voiceless way to be aliveWheel tracks entrench themselves in snow, yet paintedHe is harsh, dismal, ice—that is, exiled;A frame of glided twilight—IWhere lamps are lit: these, too,But what I am looking at is hardened snow,The bees are buzzing,Silence, are in his hand—birds in a snare;That patch of white at the very end of the roadBeneath the snowflakes I notice façades
